panels.description:
Slowest rule group evaluation times (above > 1s).
Warnings happen when they take longer than their evaluation period.
panels.title: Slowest Rule Group Evaluations per $interval

panels.description:
Percentage of time prometheus spends computing the rule. Basically the previous panel, but divided by the group interval (how frequently it should re-evaluate).

Only showing ones active more than 0.01% of the time.
panels.title: Slowest Rule Group Evaluations Normalised per $interval

panels.description: Rules where evaluation failures have been noted. If this persists, please go to prometheus rules and look at reasons for why. If they persist it could lead to data loss on recording rules, and alerts not firing.
panels.title: Evaluation Failures

panels.description: Rule group evaluations that got missed
panels.title: Missed Evaluations per $interval

options.content:
- Scrape timeouts (at 10s) trigger [TargetDown](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/blob/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack/templates/prometheus/rules-1.14/general.rules.yaml#L27) alerts
- Faulty nodes can fail kubelet.  Refresh `ep promstack-kubelet` to force operator updates.

- Sync durations are durations for Kubernetes sync for service discovery
- Sync durations should only be high for multi-scrape jobs such as mesh + catch-all monitors.

panels.description: Jobs with total sync times > 0s across all its targets.
panels.title: Long Sync Durations

panels.description: What percentage of  queries successfully respond without server errors.
panels.title: Query Availability

panels.description: Metrics that indicate problems when percentages are noticeable.
panels.title: Error Rates
